website_summaries.verdict: Advanced call-handling features make this a good choice for a busy office.
pros: Includes support for multiple phone line connections at once
Provides Bluetooth connectivity so you can use wireless handsets or make and receive cellular calls through the conference phone system
cons: Doesn't hold a connection with certain telephone system providers

customer_reviews.title: Not able to use for conference calls
customer_reviews.text: We haven't been able to use this device for conference calls because everyone else on the line says they can't hear because voices sound like mumbling or a lot of echo. This is despite their being no other caller's microphones in the area and holding the remote microphones of the system in hand by the speaker. We're having to buy a new/different system. Its too late for me to return now so its an expensive paper weight.
customer_reviews.author: Awapi

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Better than the Grandstream
customer_reviews.text: Works great! The Grandstream is better? Yeah, right. Hands down the easiest conference phone to use without unnecessary bells and whistles that nobody ever ends up using anyways. My office and our executives wanted a phone that was simple and easy to use. A phone with great voice quality and the ability to talk over each other without cutting each others off (full duplex). The detachable microphones are a bonus and a great feature since it is built into the hardware. I would recommend this phone if your executives have been complaining about the Polycoms in your office.
customer_reviews.author: hardtoplease

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but go with the 4 remote mic model.
customer_reviews.text: If you’re deciding between this model and the other with 4 remote mics, go with the 4. We used this in a small room, and having the extra mics would have made our experience better. Otherwise connects perfectly to a cell phone via Bluetooth, no special service required. Use your cell phone conferencing features/services to initiate the calls.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Hughes

customer_reviews.title: For Skype, get the USB version, NOT the Bluetooth version
customer_reviews.text: We bought the bluetooth version (VCS752) to use for Skype calls. The audio quality was good when connected to a MacBook Pro, but TERRIBLE when connected to a Mac Mini. I guess that's more of a problem with the Mac Mini's bluetooth radio than the vTech, but I just wanted others to know... if you plan to use this speakerphone for connecting to a PC, get the USB version (VCS754). We bought the VCS754 and now the sound is crystal clear.
customer_reviews.author: SHINJIRO KAWAKAMI

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Happy with it. Of course it's not as clear as a hand set, but nothing is. Works great in our conference room.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel T Kohls

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: I thought it would come with better instructions and for the price expected more bells and whistles.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy for Bluetooth function
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to use as a bluetooth speakerphone, the connection is near impossible, and it constantly disconnects. Do not buy this for to connect via bluetooth.
customer_reviews.author: Conference Phone

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great phone. Bluetooth connection is wonderful as well as the remote mics. Good for any conference room
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy J Klein

customer_reviews.title: So much promises, but none accomplished
customer_reviews.text: A waste of a lot of money, my grandatream 60 bucks ipphones works better for conference than this device, no noise cancelation, a lot of echo, robot voice on bluetooth, is only good to hear music. :S, hope I could return it or get it to work as it is supposed, for now a waste of money
customer_reviews.author: AFZP

customer_reviews.title: Not clear in the description that this devise needs to ...
customer_reviews.text: Not clear in the description that this devise needs to be hooked up to some business phone system. Not portable which is what we need.
customer_reviews.author: auntsusie

customer_reviews.title: It is very easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: We have two of these at the federal office where I work. I am the engineer who set them up. It is very easy to set up. The microphones are very clear. Without prompting we immediately started getting comments about the clarity of the sound from other people on calls. They are inexpensive, well constructed, have a wide variety of features, and provide very clear sound. I LOVE these phones. One note: You may wish to uncheck LLDP-MED. It is a protocol designed to make deploying VOIP telephones easier. In our case it confused some of our voip phones, causing them to reboot.
customer_reviews.author: AllMightyKnowItSome

customer_reviews.title: superior conference phone
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 for my General. It is fantastic. Great sound quality. I don't know why other people are complaining.
customer_reviews.author: senecalinder

product_meta.title: VTech Communications VCS752 ErisStation SIP Conference Phone with Two Wireless Mics
product_meta.description: Includes 1 fixed microphones and 2 DECT 6.0 wireless microphones with Orbitlink Wireless Technology and support for up to 3 SIP lines/accounts
feature_bullets: Bluetooth connectivity for headset and mobile pairing
